<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227431Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	11. INVESTMENTS IN AFFILIATES (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Caiasa&#151;Paraguay Complejo Agroindustrial Angostura S.A
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge has a 33.33% ownership interest in an oilseed processing facility joint
	venture with Louis Dreyfus Commodities and Aceitera General Deheza&nbsp;S.A. ("AGD"), in Paraguay.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Terminal 6&nbsp;S.A. and Terminal 6 Industrial S.A
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge has a joint venture in Argentina with AGD for the operation of the Terminal 6 port facility
	located in the Santa Fe province of Argentina. Bunge is also a party to a second joint venture with AGD that operates a crushing facility located adjacent to the Terminal 6 port facility. Bunge owns
	40% and 50%, respectively, of these joint ventures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sugar and Bioenergy
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Solazyme Bunge Produtos Renovaveis&nbsp;Ltda. ("SB Oils")
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;In April 2012, Bunge entered into a joint venture with Solazyme&nbsp;Inc. for the
	production of renewable oils in Brazil, using sugar supplied by one of Bunge's mills. Bunge has a 49.9% interest in this entity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ProMaiz
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge has a joint venture in Argentina with AGD for the construction and operation of a corn wet milling facility. Bunge is a 50% owner in
	this joint venture.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Southwest Iowa Renewable Energy,&nbsp;LLC ("SIRE")
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge is a 25% owner of SIRE. The other owners are primarily agricultural producers located in
	Southwest Iowa. SIRE operates an ethanol plant near Bunge's oilseed processing facility in Council Bluffs, Iowa.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_48"></A>

</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	These
	non-current assets arise primarily from Bunge's Brazilian operations and their realization could take in excess of five years.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recoverable taxes, net
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Recoverable taxes are reported net of valuation allowances of $20&nbsp;million and $31&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31,
	2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Judicial deposits
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Judicial deposits are funds that Bunge has placed on deposit with the courts in Brazil. These funds are held in judicial escrow
	relating to certain legal proceedings pending legal
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-25
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=103,EFW="2227431",CP="BUNGE LIMITED",DN="1",CHK=596770,FOLIO='F-25',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15401]FQ15401A.;17',USER='DSLOAN',CD='25-FEB-2016;14:56' -->
<A NAME="A2227431Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FQ15401_1_26">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227431Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. OTHER NON-CURRENT ASSETS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	resolution
	and bear interest at the SELIC rate, which is the benchmark rate of the Brazilian central bank.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income taxes receivable
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Income taxes receivable includes overpayments of current income taxes plus accrued interest. These income tax prepayments are
	expected to be utilized for settlement of future income tax obligations. Income taxes receivable in Brazil bear interest at the SELIC rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term investments
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Long-term investments represent primarily investments held by certain managed investment funds, which are included in Bunge's
	consolidated financial statements. The consolidated funds are, for U.S.&nbsp;GAAP purposes, investment companies and therefore are not required to consolidate their majority owned and controlled
	investments. Bunge reflects these investments at fair value. The fair value of these investments (a Level&nbsp;3 measurement) is nil and $208&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively. The decline of these investments is a result of the discontinuance of Bunge's asset management activities. At December&nbsp;31, 2015 Bunge expects that certain of the investments in
	these investment funds will be sold in the next twelve months and as such they have been reclassified to current in the consolidated balance sheet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Affiliate loans receivable, net
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Affiliate loans receivable, net is primarily interest bearing receivables from unconsolidated affiliates with an
	initial maturity of greater than one year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term receivables from farmers in Brazil, net
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge provides financing to farmers in Brazil, primarily through secured advances against farmer
	commitments to deliver agricultural commodities (primarily soybeans) upon harvest of the then-current year's crop and through credit sales of fertilizer to farmers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	table below summarizes Bunge's recorded investment in long-term receivables from farmers in Brazil.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_49"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7PT" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	All
	amounts in legal process are considered past due upon initiation of legal action.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	All
	renegotiated amounts are current on repayment terms.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	average recorded investment in long-term receivables from farmers in Brazil for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was $214&nbsp;million and $289&nbsp;million,
	respectively. The table below
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-26
</FONT>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. OTHER NON-CURRENT ASSETS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	summarizes
	Bunge's recorded investment in long-term receivables from farmers in Brazil and the related allowance amounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">

	table below summarizes the activity in the allowance for doubtful accounts related to long-term receivables from farmers in Brazil.

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. INCOME TAXES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge operates globally and is subject to the tax laws and regulations of numerous tax jurisdictions and authorities, as well as tax agreements and treaties among these jurisdictions.
	Bunge's tax provision is impacted by, among other factors, changes in tax laws, regulations, agreements and treaties, currency exchange rates and Bunge's profitability in each taxing jurisdiction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge
	has elected to use the U.S. federal income tax rate to reconcile the actual provision for income taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	components of income from operations before income tax are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_53"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Included
	in current income tax expense are $14&nbsp;million, $(6) million, and $32&nbsp;million related to uncertain tax benefits for the
	years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.

<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	income tax assets and liabilities are measured using the enacted tax rates expected to apply to the years in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or
	settled.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With
	respect to its unremitted earnings that are not considered to be indefinitely reinvested, Bunge has provided a deferred tax liability totaling $11&nbsp;million and
	$10&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, Bunge has determined it has unremitted earnings that are considered to be indefinitely
	reinvested of approximately $902&nbsp;million and, accordingly, no provision for income taxes has been made. If these earnings were distributed in the form of dividends or otherwise, Bunge would be
	subject to income taxes either in the form of withholding taxes or income taxes to the recipient; however, it is not practicable to estimate the amount of taxes that would be payable upon remittance
	of these earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, Bunge's pre-tax loss carryforwards totaled $3,235&nbsp;million, of which $2,269&nbsp;million have no expiration, including loss carryforwards of
	$1,472&nbsp;million in Brazil. While loss carryforwards in Brazil can be carried forward indefinitely, annual utilization is limited to 30% of taxable income calculated on an entity by entity basis
	as Brazil tax law does not provide for a consolidated return concept. As a result, realization of these carryforwards may take in excess of five
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-30
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2227431Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS15401_1_31">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227431Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. INCOME TAXES (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	years.
	The remaining tax loss carryforwards expire at various periods beginning in 2015 through the year 2030.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income Tax Valuation Allowances
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge records valuation allowances when current evidence does not suggest that some portion or all of its deferred tax
	assets will be realized. The ultimate realization of deferred tax assets depends primarily on Bunge's ability to generate sufficient timely future income of the appropriate character in the
	appropriate taxing jurisdiction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, Bunge has recorded valuation allowances of $798&nbsp;million and $1,078&nbsp;million, respectively. The net decrease of $280&nbsp;million
	results primarily from cumulative translation adjustments for Brazil and other business operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Uncertain Tax Positions
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;ASC Topic 740 requires applying a "more likely than not" threshold to the recognition and de-recognition of tax benefits.
	Accordingly Bunge recognizes the amount of tax benefit that has a greater than 50&nbsp;percent likelihood of being ultimately realized upon settlement. At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively, Bunge had recorded uncertain tax positions of $63&nbsp;million and $81&nbsp;million in other non-current liabilities and $1&nbsp;million and $2&nbsp;million in current
	liabilities in its consolidated balance sheets. During 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, Bunge recognized $1&nbsp;million, $16&nbsp;million and $10&nbsp;million of interest and penalty charges
	in income tax (expense) benefit in the consolidated statements of income. At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, Bunge had included accrued interest and penalties of $26&nbsp;million
	and $26&nbsp;million within the related tax liability line in the consolidated balance sheets. A reconciliation of the beginning and ending amount of unrecognized tax benefits follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Substantially
	all of the unrecognized tax benefits balance, if recognized, would affect Bunge's effective income tax rate. Bunge believes that it is reasonably possible that
	approximately $10&nbsp;million of its unrecognized tax benefits may be recognized by the end of 2015 as a result of a lapse of the statute of limitations or settlement with the tax authorities.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-31

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. INCOME TAXES (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge,
	through its subsidiaries, files income tax returns in the United States (federal and various states) and non-United States jurisdictions. The table below reflects the tax years
	for which Bunge is subject to income tax examinations by tax authorities:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->

</TD>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS END -->

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</TD>

<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<FONT SIZE=2>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<FONT SIZE=2>

	Europe
</FONT>
</TD>

</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;

	2003 - 2015
</FONT>
</TD>

</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, Bunge's Brazilian subsidiaries have received income tax assessments relating to 2008 through 2012 of approximately 3,494&nbsp;million Brazilian
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	reais
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(approximately
	$895&nbsp;million), plus applicable interest on the outstanding amount. Bunge has recorded unrecognized tax benefits related to
	these tax assessments of 23&nbsp;million Brazilian
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	reais
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(approximately $6&nbsp;million) as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, Bunge's Argentine subsidiary had received income tax assessments relating to 2006 through 2009 of approximately 1,381&nbsp;million
	Argentine
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	pesos
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(approximately $105&nbsp;million), plus applicable interest on the outstanding amount due of approximately 3,089&nbsp;million
	Argentine
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	pesos
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(approximately $237&nbsp;million). Bunge anticipates that the tax authorities will examine fiscal years 2010-2013, although no notice
	has been rendered to Bunge's Argentine subsidiary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management,
	in consultation with external legal advisors, believes that it is more likely than not that Bunge will prevail on the proposed assessments (with exception of unrecognized tax
	benefit discussed above) in Brazil and Argentina and intends to vigorously defend its position against these assessments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge
	made cash income tax payments, net of refunds received, of $271&nbsp;million, $303&nbsp;million and $156&nbsp;million during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014
	and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge's various financial instruments include certain components of working capital such as cash and cash equivalents, trade accounts receivable and trade accounts payable. Additionally,
	Bunge uses short and long-term debt to fund operating requirements. Cash and cash equivalents, trade accounts receivable, trade accounts payable and short-term debt are stated at their carrying value,
	which is a reasonable estimate of fair value. See Note&nbsp;18 for deferred purchase price receivable related to sales of trade receivables. See Note&nbsp;12 for long-term receivables from farmers
	in Brazil, net and other long-term investments, see Note&nbsp;17 for long-term debt, see Note&nbsp;10 for other non-recurring fair value measurements and see Note&nbsp;19 employee benefit plans.
	Bunge's financial instruments also include derivative instruments and marketable securities, which are stated at fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair
	value is the expected price that would be received for an asset or paid to transfer a liability (an exit price) in the principal or most advantageous market for the asset or
	liability in an orderly transaction between market participants on the measurement date. Bunge determines the fair values of its readily marketable inventories, derivatives, and certain other assets
	based on the fair value hierarchy, which requires an entity to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-32
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=110,EFW="2227431",CP="BUNGE LIMITED",DN="1",CHK=452915,FOLIO='F-32',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15401]FS15401A.;11',USER='CHE108975',CD='23-FEB-2016;23:11' -->
<A NAME="A2227431Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS15401_1_33">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227431Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	unobservable
	inputs when measuring fair value. Observable inputs are inputs based on market data obtained from sources independent of Bunge that reflect the assumptions market participants would use
	in pricing the asset or liability. Unobservable inputs are inputs that are developed based on the best information available in circumstances that reflect Bunge's own assumptions based on market data
	and on assumptions that market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability. The fair value standard describes three levels within its hierarchy that may be used to measure fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Level&nbsp;1:
	Quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities. Level&nbsp;1 assets and liabilities include exchange traded derivative contracts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Level&nbsp;2:
	Observable inputs, including Level&nbsp;1 prices (adjusted), quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities, quoted prices in markets that are less active than traded
	exchanges and other inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the assets or liabilities. Level&nbsp;2 assets and liabilities
	include readily marketable inventories and over-the-counter ("OTC") commodity purchase and sale contracts and other OTC derivatives whose value is determined using pricing models with inputs that are
	generally based on exchange traded prices, adjusted for location specific inputs that are primarily observable in the market or can be derived principally from or corroborated by observable market
	data.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Level&nbsp;3:
	Unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are a significant component of the fair value of the assets or liabilities. In evaluating
	the significance of fair value inputs, Bunge gives consideration to items that individually or when aggregated with other inputs, generally represent more than 10% of the fair value of the assets or
	liabilities. For such identified inputs, judgments are required when evaluating both quantitative and qualitative factors in the determination of significance for purposes of fair value level
	classification and disclosure. Level&nbsp;3 assets and liabilities include assets and liabilities whose value is determined using proprietary pricing models, discounted cash flow methodologies or
	similar techniques; as well as, assets and liabilities for which the determination of fair value requires significant management judgment or estimation. Bunge believes a change in these inputs would
	not result in a significant change in the fair values.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	majority of Bunge's exchange traded agricultural commodity futures are settled daily generally through its clearing subsidiary and, therefore, such futures are not included in the
	table below. Assets and liabilities are classified in their entirety based on the lowest level of input that is a significant component of the fair value measurement. The lowest level of input is
	considered Level&nbsp;3.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-33
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2227431Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS15401_1_34">

</FONT>
</P>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>

	&#8203;
<FONT>
</FONT>

</TR>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Trade
	accounts receivable and payable are generally stated at historical amounts, net of write-offs and allowances. with the exception of
	$6&nbsp;million and $443&nbsp;million, at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and $23&nbsp;million and $392&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2014, respectively, related to certain delivered inventory
	for which the receivable and payable, respectively, fluctuate based on changes in commodity prices. These receivables and payables are hybrid financial instruments for which Bunge has elected the fair
	value option.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Unrealized
	gains on designated and undesignated derivative contracts are generally included in other current assets. There are no such amounts
	included in other non-current assets at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, respectively.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(3)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Other
	includes the fair values of marketable securities and investments in other current assets and other non-current assets.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-34
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=112,EFW="2227431",CP="BUNGE LIMITED",DN="1",CHK=358496,FOLIO='F-34',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15401]FS15401A.;11',USER='CHE108975',CD='23-FEB-2016;23:11' -->
<A NAME="A2227431Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS15401_1_35">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227431Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(4)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Unrealized
	losses on designated and undesignated derivative contracts are generally included in other current liabilities. There are no such
	amounts included in other non-current liabilities at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Exchange traded futures and options contracts are valued based on unadjusted quoted prices in active markets and are classified within
	Level&nbsp;1. Bunge's forward commodity purchase and sale contracts are classified as derivatives along with other over the counter ("OTC") derivative instruments relating primarily to freight,
	energy, foreign exchange and interest rates, and are classified within Level&nbsp;2 or Level&nbsp;3 as described below. Bunge estimates fair values based on exchange quoted prices, adjusted as
	appropriate for differences in local markets. These differences
	are generally valued using inputs from broker or dealer quotations, or market transactions in either the listed or OTC markets. In such cases, these derivative contracts are classified within
	Level&nbsp;2.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;OTC
	derivative contracts include swaps, options and structured transactions that are valued at fair value generally determined using quantitative models that require the use of multiple
	market inputs including quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in markets which are not highly active, other
	observable inputs relevant to the asset or liability, and market inputs corroborated by correlation or other means. These valuation models include inputs such as interest rates, prices and indices to
	generate continuous yield or pricing curves and volatility factors. Where observable inputs are available for substantially the full term of the asset or liability, the instrument is categorized in
	Level&nbsp;2. Certain OTC derivatives trade in less active markets with less availability of pricing information and certain structured transactions can require internally developed model inputs
	that might not be observable in or corroborated by the market. When unobservable inputs have a significant impact on the measurement of fair value, the instrument is categorized in Level&nbsp;3.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exchange
	traded or cleared derivative contracts are classified in Level&nbsp;1, thus transfers of assets and liabilities into and/or out of Level&nbsp;1 occur infrequently. Transfers
	into Level&nbsp;1 would generally only be expected to occur when an exchange cleared derivative contract historically valued using a valuation model as the result of a lack of observable inputs
	becomes sufficiently observable, resulting in the valuation price being essentially the exchange traded price. There were no significant transfers into or out of Level&nbsp;1 during the periods
	presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Readily marketable inventories
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;RMI reported at fair value are valued based on commodity futures exchange quotations, broker or dealer quotations, or
	market transactions in either listed or OTC markets with appropriate adjustments for differences in local markets where Bunge's inventories are located. In such cases, the inventory is classified
	within Level&nbsp;2. Certain inventories may utilize significant unobservable data related to local market adjustments to determine fair value. In such cases, the inventory is classified as
	Level&nbsp;3.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	Bunge used different methods or factors to determine fair values, amounts reported as unrealized gains and losses on derivative contracts and RMI at fair value in the consolidated
	balance sheets and consolidated statements of income could differ. Additionally, if market conditions change subsequent to the reporting date, amounts reported in future periods as unrealized gains
	and losses on derivative contracts and RMI at fair value in the consolidated balance sheets and consolidated statements of income could differ.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-35
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=113,EFW="2227431",CP="BUNGE LIMITED",DN="1",CHK=853959,FOLIO='F-35',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15401]FS15401A.;11',USER='CHE108975',CD='23-FEB-2016;23:11' -->
<A NAME="A2227431Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS15401_1_36">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227431Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Level&nbsp;3 Measurements
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Transfers in and/or out of Level&nbsp;3 represent existing assets or liabilities that were either previously categorized
	as a higher level for which the inputs to the model became unobservable or assets and liabilities that were previously classified as Level&nbsp;3 for which the lowest significant input became
	observable during the period. Bunge's policy regarding the timing of transfers between levels is to record the transfers at the beginning of the reporting period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Level&nbsp;3 Derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Level&nbsp;3 derivative instruments utilize both market observable and unobservable inputs within the fair value
	measurements. These inputs include commodity prices, price volatility, interest rates, volumes and locations. In addition, with the exception of the exchange cleared instruments, Bunge is exposed to
	loss in the event of the non-performance by counterparties on OTC derivative instruments and forward purchase and sale contracts. Adjustments are made to fair values on occasions when non-performance
	risk is determined to represent a significant input in Bunge's fair value determination. These adjustments are based on Bunge's estimate of the potential loss in the event of counterparty
	non-performance. Bunge did not have significant adjustments related to non-performance by counterparties at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Level&nbsp;3 Readily marketable inventories and other
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;The significant unobservable inputs resulting in Level&nbsp;3 classification for RMI,
	physically settled forward purchase and sale contracts, and trade accounts receivable and payable, net, relate to certain management estimations regarding costs of transportation and other local
	market or location-related adjustments, primarily freight related adjustments in the interior of Brazil and the lack of market corroborated information in Canada. In both situations, Bunge uses
	proprietary information such as purchase and sale contracts and contracted prices for freight, premiums and discounts to value its contracts. Movements in the price of these unobservable inputs alone
	would not have a material effect on Bunge's financial statements as these contracts do not typically exceed one future crop cycle.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	tables below present reconciliations for assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis using significant unobservable inputs (Level&nbsp;3) during the years
	ended December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-36
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2015
	and 2014. These instruments were valued using pricing models that management believes reflect the assumptions that would be used by a marketplace participant.
</FONT>

<TH COLSPAN=11 ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">

</B>

</TH>
<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Derivatives,
	net include Level&nbsp;3 derivative assets and liabilities.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Trade
	Accounts Receivable and Trade Accounts Payable, net, include Level&nbsp;3 inventory related receivables and payables.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Derivative Instruments
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest rate derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge from time-to-time uses interest rate derivatives, including interest rate swaps, interest rate basis swaps, interest
	rate options or interest rate futures. During 2015, Bunge entered into interest rate swap agreements for the purpose of managing certain of its interest
	rate exposures. The interest rate swaps used by Bunge as hedging instruments have been recorded at fair value in the consolidated balance sheets with changes in fair value recorded contemporaneously
	in earnings. These swap agreements have been designated as fair value hedges. Additionally, the carrying amount of the associated hedged debt is adjusted through earnings for changes in the fair value
	arising from changes in benchmark interest rates. Ineffectiveness is recognized to the extent that these two adjustments do not offset.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, Bunge had fixed-to-variable interest rate agreements having a total notional amount of $500&nbsp;million that requires Bunge to pay interest at a
	variable rate and receive interest at 3.5%. These interest rate swap agreements are designated as fair value hedges of $500&nbsp;million of its 3.5% 2020 Senior Notes (See Note&nbsp;17).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-38
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	table below summarizes the notional amounts of open interest rate positions.

	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>

<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<DIV STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:62PT;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
<B>
	(US$ in millions)
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCROPPEDRULE,62PT -->
</B>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TH>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Interest
	is payable in arrears semi-annually based on three-month U.S. dollar LIBOR plus 1.91%.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Interest
	is receivable in arrears based on a fixed interest rate of 3.5%.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(3)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	interest rate swap agreements mature in 2020.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Foreign exchange derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge uses a combination of foreign exchange forward, futures, swap and option contracts in certain of its operations to
	mitigate the risk from exchange rate fluctuations in connection with certain commercial and balance sheet exposures. The foreign exchange forward and option contracts may be designated as cash flow
	hedges. Bunge may also use net investment hedges to partially offset the translation adjustments arising from the remeasurement of its investment in certain of its foreign subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge
	assesses, both at the inception of the hedge and on an ongoing basis, whether the derivatives that are used in hedge transactions are highly effective in offsetting changes in the
	hedged items.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	table below summarizes the notional amounts of open foreign exchange positions.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_64"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">

</FONT>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Exchange
	traded derivatives are presented on a net (short) and long position basis.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Non-exchange
	traded derivatives are presented on a gross (short) and long position basis.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Commodity derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge uses commodity derivative instruments to manage its exposure to movements associated with agricultural commodity prices.
	Bunge generally uses exchange traded futures and options contracts to minimize the effects of changes in the prices of agricultural commodities on its agricultural commodity inventories and forward
	purchase and sale contracts, but may also from time-to-time enter into OTC commodity transactions, including swaps, which are settled in cash at
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-39
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=117,EFW="2227431",CP="BUNGE LIMITED",DN="1",CHK=441412,FOLIO='F-39',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15401]FU15401A.;27',USER='MTITUSS',CD='24-FEB-2016;14:31' -->
<A NAME="A2227431Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU15401_1_40">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227431Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	maturity
	or termination based on exchange-quoted futures prices. Forward purchase and sale contracts are primarily settled through delivery of agricultural commodities. While Bunge considers these
	exchange traded futures and forward purchase and sale contracts to be effective economic hedges, Bunge does not designate or account for the majority of its commodity contracts as hedges. The forward
	contracts require performance of both Bunge and the contract counterparty in future periods. Contracts to purchase agricultural commodities generally relate to current or future crop years for
	delivery periods quoted by regulated commodity exchanges. Contracts for the sale of agricultural commodities generally do not extend beyond one future crop cycle.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	table below summarizes the volumes of open agricultural commodities derivative positions.
</FONT>

</DT>

	Exchange
	traded derivatives are presented on a net (short) and long position basis.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>

<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	Non-exchange
	traded derivatives are presented on a gross (short) and long position basis.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ocean freight derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge uses derivative instruments referred to as freight forward agreements (FFAs) and FFA options to hedge portions of its
	current and anticipated ocean freight costs. Changes in the fair values of ocean freight derivatives that are not designated as hedges are recorded in earnings. There were no designated hedges at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	table below summarizes the open ocean freight positions.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_66"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Exchange
	cleared derivatives are presented on a net (short) and long position basis.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Non-exchange
	cleared derivatives are presented on a gross (short) and long position basis.
</FONT>
</DD>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_67"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Energy derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;Bunge uses energy derivative instruments for various purposes including to manage its exposure to volatility in energy costs.
	Bunge's operations use substantial amounts of energy, including natural gas, coal, and fuel oil, including bunker fuel.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	table below summarizes the open energy positions.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Exchange
	traded and cleared derivatives are presented on a net (short) and long position basis.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Non-exchange
	cleared derivatives are presented on a gross (short) and long position basis.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(3)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Million
	British Thermal Units (MMBtus) is the standard unit of measurement used to denote an amount of natural gas.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-41
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_INCOME_STATEMENT_2"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	The Effect of Derivative Instruments on the Consolidated Statements of Income
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The table below summarizes the effect of derivative instruments that are designated as fair value hedges and also derivative
	instruments that are undesignated on the consolidated statements of income for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">

	&#8203;

</DIV>
</EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	table below summarizes the effect of derivative instruments that are designated and qualify as cash flow and net investment hedges on the consolidated statement of income.

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	gain (loss) recognized relates to the effective portion of the hedging relationship. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, Bunge expects to
	reclassify into income in the next 12&nbsp;months $76&nbsp;million after-tax loss related to its foreign exchange cash flow and nil for net investment hedges.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	There
	was no gain or loss recognized in income relating to the ineffective portion of the hedging relationships or relating to amounts
	excluded from the assessment of hedge effectiveness.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-42
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	gain or (loss) recognized relates to the effective portion of the hedging relationship. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, Bunge expected to
	reclassify into income in the next 12&nbsp;months approximately $4&nbsp;million after-tax gains (losses) related to its foreign exchange cash flow hedges and nil for net investment hedges.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	There
	was no gain or loss recognized in income relating to the ineffective portion of the hedging relationships or to amounts excluded from
	the assessment of hedge effectiveness.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(3)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	foreign exchange contracts matured at various dates in 2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	16. SHORT-TERM DEBT AND CREDIT FACILITIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge's short-term borrowings are typically sourced from various banking institutions and the U.S. commercial paper market. Bunge also borrows from time to time in local currencies in
	various foreign jurisdictions. Interest expense includes facility commitment fees, amortization of deferred financing costs and charges on certain lending transactions, including certain intercompany
	loans and foreign
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-43
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	$130&nbsp;million and $155&nbsp;million of local currency borrowings in certain Central and Eastern European, South American and
	Asia-Pacific countries at a weighted-average interest rate of 16.06% and 11.95% as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge's
	commercial paper program is supported by an identical amount of committed back up bank credit lines (the "Liquidity Facility") provided by banks that are rated at least A-1 by
	Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's Financial Services and P-1 by Moody's Investors Service. On November&nbsp;20, 2014, Bunge entered into an unsecured $600&nbsp;million five-year Liquidity Facility with
	certain lenders party thereto. The Liquidity Facility replaced the then existing $600&nbsp;million five-year liquidity facility, dated as of November&nbsp;17, 2011. The cost of borrowing under the
	Liquidity Facility would typically be higher than the cost of issuing under Bunge's commercial paper program. At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, there were no borrowings
	outstanding under the commercial paper program and no borrowings under the Liquidity Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition to the committed facilities discussed above, from time-to-time, Bunge Limited and/or its financing subsidiaries enter into uncommitted bilateral short-term credit lines as
	necessary based on its financing requirements. At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, nil and $50&nbsp;million were outstanding under these bilateral short-term credit lines, respectively. Loans
	under such credit lines are non-callable by the respective lenders. In addition, Bunge's operating companies had $626&nbsp;million in short-term borrowings outstanding from local bank lines of
	credit at December&nbsp;31, 2015 to support working capital requirements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-44
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Consolidated investment fund debt

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Consolidated
	investment fund debt matures at various dates through 2018 with no recourse to Bunge. Bunge elected to account for
	$53&nbsp;million and $195&nbsp;million at fair value as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	fair values of long-term debt, including current portion, at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 were $3,940&nbsp;million and $3,468&nbsp;million, respectively, calculated based on
	interest rates currently available on comparable maturities to companies with credit standing similar to that of Bunge. The carrying amounts and fair values of long-term debt are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_72"></A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	November&nbsp;24, 2015, Bunge completed the sale of $500&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of unsecured senior notes bearing interest at 3.50% per annum and maturing on
	November&nbsp;24, 2020. The senior notes were issued by Bunge's 100% owned finance subsidiary, Bunge Limited Finance Corp., and are fully and unconditionally guaranteed by Bunge Limited. The
	offering was made pursuant to a registration statement filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. The net proceeds of approximately $496&nbsp;million were used for general corporate
	purposes, including, but not limited to the repayment of outstanding indebtedness, which includes indebtedness under revolving credit facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	August&nbsp;10, 2015, Bunge entered into an amendment agreement to its unsecured $1,750&nbsp;million syndicated revolving credit facility, dated March&nbsp;17, 2014 (the
	"Facility"). The amendment agreement
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-45
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=123,EFW="2227431",CP="BUNGE LIMITED",DN="1",CHK=538663,FOLIO='F-45',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15401]FU15401A.;27',USER='MTITUSS',CD='24-FEB-2016;14:31' -->
<A NAME="A2227431Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU15401_1_46">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227431Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	17. LONG-TERM DEBT AND CREDIT FACILITIES (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	extends
	the maturity date of the Facility to August&nbsp;10, 2018. Bunge has the option to request an extension of the maturity date of the Facility for two additional one-year periods. Each lender
	in its sole discretion may agree to any such request. The amendment agreement also lowers the range of margin applicable to Bunge's borrowings under the Facility. Borrowings under the Facility will
	bear interest at LIBOR plus a margin, which will vary from 0.35% to 1.35% per annum, based on the credit ratings of Bunge's senior long-term unsecured debt. Bunge will also pay a fee that varies from
	0.10% to 0.40% per annum, based on the utilization of the Facility. Amounts under the Facility that remain undrawn are subject to a commitment fee payable quarterly in arrears at a rate of 35% of the
	margin specified above, which will vary based on the rating level at each quarterly payment date. Bunge may, from time-to-time, with the consent of the facility agent, request one or more of the
	existing lenders or new lenders to increase the total commitments under the Facility by up to $250&nbsp;million pursuant to an accordion provision. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, Bunge had
	$277&nbsp;million of borrowings outstanding under the Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, Bunge had $4,263&nbsp;million of unused and available borrowing capacity under its committed long-term credit facilities with a number of lending
	institutions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain
	land, property, equipment and investments in consolidated subsidiaries having a net carrying value of approximately $130&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 have been
	mortgaged or otherwise collateralized against long-term debt of $58&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Principal Maturities
</I>
</FONT>

	&#151;Principal maturities of long-term debt at December&nbsp;31, 2015 are as follows:

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Excludes
	unamortized net gains of $4&nbsp;million related to terminated interest rate swap agreement and unamortized net losses of
	$3&nbsp;million related to an open interest rate swap agreement recorded in long-term debt.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge's
	credit facilities and certain senior notes require it to comply with specified financial covenants related to minimum net worth, minimum current ratio, a maximum debt to
	capitalization ratio and limitations on secured indebtedness. Bunge was in compliance with these covenants at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, Bunge paid interest, net of interest capitalized, of $227&nbsp;million, $223&nbsp;million and $330&nbsp;million,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-46
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=124,EFW="2227431",CP="BUNGE LIMITED",DN="1",CHK=733752,FOLIO='F-46',FILE='DISK134:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15401]FU15401A.;27',USER='MTITUSS',CD='24-FEB-2016;14:31' -->
<A NAME="A2227431Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU15401_1_47">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227431Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	18. TRADE RECEIVABLES SECURITIZATION PROGRAM
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge and certain of its subsidiaries participate in a trade receivables securitization program ("Program") with a financial institution, as administrative agent, and certain commercial
	paper conduit purchasers and committed purchasers (collectively, the Purchasers) that provides for funding of up to $700&nbsp;million against receivables sold into the Program. The Program is
	designed to enhance Bunge's financial flexibility by providing an additional source of liquidity for its operations. In connection with the Program, certain of Bunge's U.S. and non-U.S. subsidiaries
	that originate trade receivables may sell eligible receivables in their entirety on a revolving basis to a consolidated bankruptcy remote special
	purpose entity, Bunge Securitization&nbsp;B.V. ("BSBV") formed under the laws of The Netherlands. BSBV in turn sells such purchased trade receivables to the administrative agent (acting on behalf of
	the Purchasers) pursuant to a receivables transfer agreement. In connection with these sales of accounts receivable, Bunge receives a portion of the proceeds up front and an additional amount upon the
	collection of the underlying receivables, which is expected to be generally between 10% and 15% of the aggregate amount of receivables sold through the Program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge
	Finance&nbsp;B.V., a wholly owned subsidiary of Bunge, acts as master servicer, responsible for servicing and collecting the accounts receivable for the Program. The Program
	terminates on June&nbsp;1, 2016. The trade receivables sold under the Program are subject to specified eligibility criteria, including eligible currencies, country and obligor concentration limits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, and 2014, $524&nbsp;million and $599&nbsp;million, respectively, of receivables sold under the Program were derecognized from Bunge's consolidated
	balance sheets. Proceeds received in cash related to transfers of receivables under the Program totaled $10,396&nbsp;million and $12,030&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
	and 2014, respectively. In addition, cash collections from customers on receivables previously sold were $10,542&nbsp;million and $12,202&nbsp;million, respectively. As this is a revolving
	facility, cash collections from customers are reinvested to fund new receivable sales. Gross receivables sold under the Program for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 were
	$10,601&nbsp;million and $12,179&nbsp;million, respectively. These sales resulted in discounts of $5&nbsp;million, $7&nbsp;million and $7&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015 and 2014 and 2013, respectively, which were included in SG&amp;A in the consolidated statements of income. Servicing fees under the Program were not significant in any period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bunge's
	risk of loss following the sale of the trade receivables is limited to the deferred purchase price ("DPP"), which at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 had a fair value of
	$79&nbsp;million and $78&nbsp;million, respectively, and is included in other current assets in the consolidated balance sheets (see Note&nbsp;6). The DPP will be repaid in cash as receivables
	are collected, generally within 30&nbsp;days. Delinquencies and credit losses on trade receivables sold under the Program during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 were insignificant.
	Bunge has reflected all cash flows under the Program as operating cash flows in the consolidated statements of cash flows for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	19. EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain U.S., Canadian, European and Brazilian based subsidiaries of Bunge sponsor non-contributory defined benefit pension plans covering substantially all employees of the
	subsidiaries. The plans provide benefits based primarily on participants' salary and length of service. The funding policies for Bunge's defined benefit pension plans are determined in accordance with
	statutory funding requirements. The most significant defined benefit plan is in the United States. The U.S. funding policy requires at least those amounts required by the Pension Protection Act of
	2006. Assets of the plans consist primarily of equity and fixed income investments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-47
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	BUNGE LIMITED AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	19. EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain United States and Brazil based subsidiaries of Bunge have benefit plans to provide certain postretirement healthcare benefits to eligible retired employees of those subsidiaries.
	The plans require minimum retiree contributions and define the maximum amount the subsidiaries will be obligated to pay under the plans. Bunge's policy is to fund these costs as they become payable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Plan Amendments and Transfers In and Out
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;There were no significant amendments, settlements or transfers into or out of Bunge's employee benefit plans
	during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 or 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following table sets forth in aggregate the changes in the defined benefit pension and postretirement benefit plans' benefit obligations, assets and funded status at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 or 2014. A measurement date of December&nbsp;31 was used for all plans.
</FONT>
</P>

<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	)
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Actuarial (gain) loss, net
</FONT>
</TD>

<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-9PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Amounts recognized in the balance sheet consist of:
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
	&#8203;
